column2: NEW HAMPSHIRE DMV WRITTEN TEST
Question Text
1. When parking uphill on a road with a curb, turn the front wheels:
2. At night, it is hardest to see:
3. Service signs are ____ with ____ letters and symbols.
4. When other drivers around you are acting in anger, you should:
column6: slow down or move over safely.

column2: 5. When there is a _______ at an intersection, you should come to a complete stop, yield to cross traffic/pedestrians, and then proceed when clear.
6. Broken white lines can be crossed over:
column8: when it is safe to change lanes.

column2: 7. When changing lanes, you should not:
column4: check to see if other drivers are moving into the same lane.
column8: use the inside rearview mirror to check for blind spots
column10: check your side and rear view mirrors.

column2: 8. When the road is slippery, you should:
column8: press your brakes in slow, steady strokes.
column10: use your emergency or parking brake.

column2: 9. When approaching someone using a white cane, you should proceed with caution because:
column6: the pedestrian might be using a guide dog.

column2: 10. __________ limit(s) your concentration, perception, judgment, and memory.
column6: Even the smallest amount of alcohol
column8: Only a blood alcohol level greater than .05
column10: Only a blood alcohol level greater than the legal limit

column2: 11. If you begin to feel drowsy while driving, you should:
12. This road sign means:
13. If another vehicle is approaching you head-on in your lane, you should _______, sound your horn and brake.
column6: stay in the center of your lane
column10: None of the other answers is correct.

column2: 14. What should you do if your brakes fail?
column4: Hook your shoe under the pedal and see if you can free it.
column10: Try pumping the brake pedal to increase pressure.

column2: 15. This sign indicates that the road ahead:
16. The amount of space you need to cross traffic depends on the:
column4: number of cars in front of you.
column10: road and weather conditions and oncoming traffic.

column2: 17. This road sign means:
18. This road sign means:
column6: You must make a complete stop
column10: Yield the right-of-way to oncoming vehicles

column2: 19. This sign warns that:
column8: the bridge ahead is wide enough for only one vehicle at a time.

column2: 20. When you approach this sign, you must:
column4: watch for workers crossing the road.

column2: 21. An orange-colored sign means:
22. A green arrow used to control turns from a specific traffic lane:
column4: means that you may go only if the green arrow is accompanied by a green light.
column6: is used only on one-way streets.
column8: provide directional and mileage information to specific destinations.
column10: means the same as a circular green light, but you must go only in the direction indicated by the arrow.

column2: 23. The first sign drivers see when approaching a highway-rail intersection is usually:
24. A driver who approaches an intersection:
column4: must drive straight through the intersection, even if another vehicle is already in the intersection.
column6: has the right-of-way over traffic already in the intersection.
column8: must yield the right-of-way to traffic already in the intersection.

column2: 25. A flashing red traffic light:
column4: has the same meaning as a stop sign.
column6: has the same meaning as a yield sign.
column8: is used to indicate a pedestrian crossing.
column10: indicates that you should drive with caution.

column2: 26. When you are in a line of traffic that is crossing a railroad track that has no signals or gates:
column4: before you start to cross, you need to make sure there is space to get all the way across the tracks without stopping.
column6: you have the right of way and do not need to check for trains.
column8: you may pass slower drivers crossing the track.

column2: 27. A steady green light at intersections means:
column4: You may drive through the intersection if the road is clear
column6: You must stop and check for oncoming traffic before proceeding

column2: 28. This is the shape and color of a ________ sign.
29. You may not park:
column8: on a crosswalk or marked bicycle lane.
column10: within 200 feet of an elementary school.

column2: 30. When drivers come to this sign, they must:
column4: warn other drivers that a stop sign is ahead.
column6: be ready to stop at the stop sign.
column8: brake sharply and come to a complete stop.
column10: stop doing what they are doing.

column2: 31. What should drivers do when they see this sign?
column4: Look to the left and right for other traffic.
column8: Make sure the bridge is clear of oncoming traffic before they cross.

column2: 32. You should never depend on your mirrors when you prepare to change lanes. Why?
column8: Mirrors leave “blind spots” behind both sides of vehicles.
column10: You should look over your shoulder instead.

column2: 33. What does this road sign indicate?
column10: Area reserved for people with disabilities

column2: 34. Regulatory signs are:
35. How many different  classes of mopeds are there?
36. If you miss your exit from an interstate expressway, you should:
column4: pull over to the right and back up with caution until you reach the exit ramp.
column6: use the right turn signal, check your mirrors and move to the right.
column8: make a quick U-turn from your lane of travel.
column10: go to the next exit and come back to the exit you missed.

column2: 37. When approaching any intersection or driveway, drivers should:
column6: look both ways and be ready to stop.
column8: drive at the fastest speed just before entering the intersection.
column10: pass other vehicles and then stop.

column2: 38. Which of the following is a common cause of a traffic collisions?
39. This warning sign means:
column4: Watch out for children crossing the street
column6: Slow down, drive with caution and watch for children

column2: 40. You are stopped at a stop sign and you are going to go straight through the intersection. A car on the cross road has stopped at a stop sign on your right and is going to go straight. Who has the right-of-way?
